moves.1. e4: Just a warning that this game is full of mistakes and/or blunders but the analysis is done anyway to learn from mistakes.
moves.1... c6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Bf5: Not that e6 is bad or anything but Bxd3 is probably slightly better and gives both opponents a more even game.
moves.10. Bxh7 Nxh7 11. Qh5 Qc7 12. Ne4 Bb4+:
Again not the best move but could not be considered bad.
Maybe developing a piece with Na6 would be okay even if it looks somewhat odd.
moves.13. c3 Ba5:
Blunder.  After the following long line we see why this is: … Ba5 13.  Nd6+  Kf8  14. Bxh6 Nf6  15. Bxg7+ Kxg7  16. Qg5+ Kf8  17. Qxf6 Rh7  18. Ndc4 Qd8  19. Qf4 Ke8  20. Nxa5 Qxa5

Suggestion maybe … Bf8 might defend the black kingside?
moves.14. Bf4:
This is a mistake if you look closer:
14. Nd6+  Kf8  15. Bxh6 Nf6  16. Bxg7+ Kxg7  17. Qg5+ Kf8  18. Qxf6 Rh7  19. Ndc4 Qd8  20. Qf4 Ke8  21. Nxa5 Qxa5 gives White a fairly big advantage.
moves.14... O-O 15. Rh3 Nd7 16. Rg3 f6 17. Ng6: Big blunder.  Checkmate in 9 (… e5 17.  Ne7+  Kh8  18. Bxh6 g5  19. hxg5 Bxc3+  20. bxc3 fxg5  21. Bg7+ Kxg7  22. Nxg5 Nxg5  23. Qg6+ Kh8  24. Rh3+ Nxh3  25. Qh6#).
moves.18. dxe5: Another blunder... Ne7+ Kh8  19. Bxh6 g5  20. hxg5 Bxc3+  21. bxc3 fxg5  22. Nxg5 exd4  23. Bg7+ Kxg7  24. Qg6+ Kh8  25. Qxh7# gives white the win.
moves.18... Rfe8 19. O-O-O: Small mistake 19. e6 seems more solid.
moves.19... fxe5: … Nxe5 would keep the game more even.
moves.20. Bxh6 Ndf6 21. Nxf6+ Nxf6 22. Qg5: Blunder.  This move allows the opponent right back into the game.  However  22. Qf5  Red8  23. Rxd8+ Rxd8  24. Nxe5 Ne8  25. Qe6+ Kh7  26. Nf7 Qd7  27. Ng5+ Kh8  28. Bxg7+ Nxg7  29. Nf7+ Kg8  30. Nxd8+ Qxe6  31. Nxe6 gives white a much bigger advantage.
moves.22... Ne4 23. Qe3:
Mistake is seen here: 23. Qe3  Nxg3  24. Qxg3 gxh6  25. Ne7+ Kh8  26. Rd7 Rxe7  27. Rxc7 Bxc7  28. Qg6 Rh7  29. Qf6+ Kg8  30. Kc2

Best move would keep the game even with: Qg4 Nxg3  24. fxg3 Rad8  25. Rxd8 Rxd8  26. Qe6+ Qf7  27. Ne7+ Kf8  28. Ng6+ Kg8
moves.23... Nxg3 24. Qxg3 e4: Mistake I believe... better is … gxh6 24.  b4  Bb6.
… Rd5 29.  Qe2  Bb6 should be considered.
moves.30... Rd5 31. Qg5: Blunder... Qg5 Qd6  32. Qg4 Rdxe5  33. Bxe5 Qxe5  34. Rf1 Qf6  35. f4 Rd8  36. Rh1 Qd6  37. h5 Qd3+  38. Ka1 Bc5
moves.31... Bxf2: Blunder again.  … Qd6 31.  Qg4  Rdxe5  32. Bxe5 Qxe5
moves.32. h5: Blunder yet again.  32. Nxd7  Rxg5  33. Bxg5 e3  34. Nc5 e2  35. Nd3 e1=Q+  36. Nxe1 Bxe1  37. Kc2 Bg3  38. Rd1 Bf2  39. Rd2 Bc5  40. g4 would give white a clear advantage.
moves.32... Qe7: Smaller error because of the following… Qe7 32.  Qxe7  Rxe7
moves.33. Qg4: Mistake:  Qxe7 Rxe7  34. Ng6 Re6 is better.
moves.33... e3 34. h6 Rxe5 35. hxg7: Another mistake this game is now approaching to an end with black having the advantage.
moves.35... Qxg7 36. Qxg7+ Kxg7 37. Bxe5+ Rxe5:
Although at this point the game is lost … e1=Q+ would be the better promotion.
After this there are still several mistakes done by the players but as said the game is over.
